com.versant.event
Class VersantEventObject

java.lang.Object
  java.util.EventObject
      com.versant.event.VersantEventObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class VersantEventObject
extends java.util.EventObject

Encapsulates an event that is delivered on an event channel. The VersantEventObject class has methods for determining the exact nature of the event, which objects were involved in generating the event, which transaction the events occurred in, and when the event occurred.

Two persistent objects are associated with each event: the "definer" and the "raiser". The raiser is the object whose creation, modification, or deletion caused the event to be raised in the database server. The definer is the object that was registered with the database server. For class-based or query-based channels, the definer is a class object (an instance of ClassHandle); for object-based channels, the definer is the same object as the raiser. Note that for event types BEGIN_TRANSACTION and END_TRANSACTION, the "definer" and "raiser" are both null.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getChannelName

public java.lang.String getChannelName()
Returns the name of the channel on which this event was delivered.

getDefiner

public java.lang.Object getDefiner(TransSession s)
Returns the "definer" of this event. This method requires a TransSession object to be passed in as input and returns a persistent Java object. In the event there is an error in converting the definer object handle to a persistent Java object then this function returns a handle to the definer object.

getDefinerHandle

public Handle getDefinerHandle(FundSession s)
Returns a Handle to the "definer" of this event. The returned object will be associated with the session of the calling thread.

getDefinerLoid

public java.lang.String getDefinerLoid()
Returns a string representation of the LOID of the "definer" of this event.

getDefinerLoidAsLong

public long getDefinerLoidAsLong(FundSession s)
Returns an 8-byte integer representation of the LOID of the "definer" of this event.

getEventType

public int getEventType()
Returns the event type of this event. The event type can be either a system event type (defined in the EventTypes interface), or a user-defined event type.

See Also:
EventTypes

getRaiser

public java.lang.Object getRaiser(TransSession s)
Returns the "raiser" of this event. The returned object will be associated with the session of the calling thread. This method requires a TransSession Object as input and returns a persistent Java object. In the event there is an error in converting the raiser object handle to a persistent Java object then this function returns a handle to the raiser object.

getRaiserHandle

public Handle getRaiserHandle(FundSession s)
Returns a Handle to the "raiser" of this event. The returned object will be associated with the session of the calling thread.

getRaiserLoid

public java.lang.String getRaiserLoid()
Returns a string representation of the LOID of the "raiser" of this event.

getRaiserLoidAsLong

public long getRaiserLoidAsLong(FundSession s)
Returns an 8-byte integer representation of the LOID of the "raiser" of this event.

getRaiserInfo

public java.lang.String getRaiserInfo()
Returns the user-defined string given in the EventClient.raiseEvent method.

See Also:
EventClient.raiseEvent(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object, int, java.lang.String)

getSource

public java.lang.Object getSource(TransSession s)
A synonym for the getRaiser method.

See Also:
VersantEventObject.getRaiser(com.versant.trans.TransSession)

getTimestamp

public long getTimestamp()
Returns a timestamp marking when the event occurred. The value returned is the number of milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC. Note, however, that the value returned has only second resolution - it is a multiple of 1000.

getTransactionID

public java.lang.String getTransactionID()
Returns a string representation of the transaction identifier for the transaction in which this event was generated. The transaction identifier is a Versant LOID.

getTransactionIdAsLong

public long getTransactionIdAsLong(FundSession s)
Returns an 8-byte integer representation of the transaction identifier for the transaction in which this event was generated.
